meanings.definition: An object, typically a rod or plate, that casts a shadow to indicate the time of day.
meanings.sent1: The gnomons on the sundial helped people tell time.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Greeks used gnomons to track the movement of the sun.
meanings.sent3: When the mischievous cat knocked over the gnomons, the time was thrown off.
meanings.sent4: The gnomons stood tall like sentinels, marking the passage of hours.
meanings.sent5: The intricate gnomons created fascinating patterns of light and shadow.

meanings.definition: The part of a parallelogram that remains after a similar parallelogram has been removed from one of its corners.
meanings.sent1: She carefully studied the gnomons of the parallelogram to solve the geometry problem.
meanings.sent2: The gnomons of the shape were crucial in calculating its area.
meanings.sent3: The missing gnomons made the parallelogram look like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: The gnomons left behind revealed the hidden symmetry of the figure.
meanings.sent5: The gnomons acted as clues, guiding her through the geometric maze.
